Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel that shows remains of two lines of hieratic text on the outside, parallel to the rim, written in black ink. The writing is accomplished in very high and clear signs. The sherd is part of a Nile clay vessel, wheel made, plate with a red rim at the outside and complete red slipped at the inside. The diameter is approximately 28cm. The inside of the vessel shows black remnants so that the vessel was probably used as lamp.
